

## Liberalism


Classical liberal

- Minimal goverment required to secure property and markets, constrained by civil liberties

Neoliberal 

- Promotes capital by minimizing regulation and taxes

Liberal Democracy 

1. democracy with individual civil liberties, especially speech, assembly, religion (someitmes called social liberalism when it embraces civil rights as well)
1. democracy with individual rights, especially property and market governance (more similar to classical liberalism)


Common thread: natural (pre-political) individual rights


## Republicanism 


Common thread: institutions against arbitrary power


Aristocratic republicanism: prioritizes property as a key institution to protect against goverment 

Democratic republicanism: institutions to equalize political power
